reviewText: the story was pretty good if you like the club scene. definitely has its own crowd...there was one scene where the lady was out in the parking lot wearing just her strip cloths; I was shocked....was kind of uncessary but oh well....other than that its the gritty story of a young model school student who works her way at night to become a success (if you like Ice Cube's Player's Club, this is your movie) there was one incredibly histerical scene where they ladies were in their dressing room, a fight broke out and a fight breaks out!!! OMG that was the funniest thing of all times. So in that regard it is well worth checking out...pretty good lighting and overall quality film production was great; look forward to seeing some of these women do other films they stood out for sure!!
summary: Black Beautiful Queens - Tell the Naked Truth!

reviewText: The Naked Truth is so similar to The Players, but The Players Club would earn more stars.  If you enjoyed Players Club, you will like this one too.  It stars Ki Toy Johnson, Tiana Jackson, Leland Jones and Trinita Turner.  It features music by Thugz Nation, 285, 404 Soldierz, The Ivey Boyz and Juvenile.  The cover has the San Francisco Black Film Festival seal for official selection displayed.The G-Spot is an Atlanta Strip Club that is corrupt.  The story focuses on three shake dancers that go by the names Cream, Cat and Belinda.  There is a lot of footage of the dancers performing, which may mislead the viewer in the beginning.  One may tend to think that the movie is all about flesh, sex, drugs and corruption...but eventually the movie gets into some substance to hold your attention and carry the storyline through.  Salem (the club's owner) seems to be all about the money.  He has Cream doing more than dancing for him, so I guess he could be called a Pimp too.  He installs video cameras so that he can see everything that happens at The G-Spot.  He has a cop on his payroll too which leads to murder and mystery.  The movie has a few redeeming qualities at the end.  One dancer graduates and gets out of the business.  A former  gay dancer, current cashier turns her life around for the better after her lover is killed.  The narrator of the story breaks it down to the naked truth.
Title: N/A

reviewText: THIS MOVIE WAS OKAY.  IT IS A LOW BUDGET PLAYER CLUB, BUT ITS STILL WATCHABLE.  THE ACTING WAS'NT GRADE A, BUT THE MOVIE DOSES HAVE A INTERESTING STORY LINE.  ITS SAID WHAT HAPPENS TO CREAM.  I WOULD SUGGEST PEOPLE BUY THE MOVIE.  ITS WORTH WATCHING AT LEAST ONCE.

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Women, for various reasons work at a gentleman's club in Atlanta that caters to primarily an African American audience. The owner of the club is being shook down by a police force detective, who desires one of the dancers. The movie contains nudity, but not enough to be called soft core. The movie contains acting, but not enough to call it cinema. F-bomb and hip-hop music. There is no real central plot.
summary: MOVIE NEEDS WRITER, DIRECTOR, AND ACTORS
